intro: Lycaste aromatica var. punctata, commonly known as the fragrant lycaste, is a hybrid orchid species native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees or other structures in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), often with a distinctive spotted or mottled appearance. This variety is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and unique fragrance.
